intro: Knautia propontica, commonly known as the Propontic knautia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Knautia propontica is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
